info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 4:09PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Thunderstorms with strong wind gusts will impact portions of Southwest, Central, and North Central Montana through at least 500 PM MDT... At 406 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms with strong wind gusts clustered around a line extending from 21 miles northwest of Turner to near Grant. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bozeman, Havre, Lewistown, Dillon, Townsend, West Yellowstone, Chinook, White Sulphur Springs, Sheridan, Big Sandy, Stanford, Virginia City, Henrys Lake, Belgrade, Three Forks, Manhattan, Whitehall, Ennis, Harlem and Twin Bridges. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 1 and 79 . Interstate 90 between mile markers 247 and 316. Highway 200 between mile markers 0 and 126. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Some of these storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
